intro: Jacquemontia heterantha, commonly known as the yellow jimsonweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in open areas such as fields and roadsides. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain numerous seeds. Jacquemontia heterantha is known for its toxic properties, making it a plant to be handled with care.
